Description: Mould-made scaraboid (?) in glazed composition; back very eroded, just a few incised lines; underside decorated with very crudely incised stylised winged animal (?), difficult to identify; glossy yellow glaze relatively well preserved; in yellow paste; quite eroded.
Curator's comments: Found unregistered, but with other objects from Naukratis with labels from the EEF from Petrie's excavations at Naukratis in 1885. The same box, however, provided an element from Kamiros (2013,5012.7). The motif displayed on the underside of this piece and the treatment of its back is unlike known scarabs and scaraboids from Naukratis. It is also larger than most glazed composition scarabs and scaraboids produced at the Scarab Factory (on its various productions, see Webb forthcoming). Therefore, its findspot should be considered with extreme caution. Webb, V. forthcoming, Faience finds from Naukratis and their implications for the chronology of the site, in R. Thomas (ed.) forthcoming. Naukratis in Context I: The Nile Delta as a Landscape of Connectivity. Proceedings of the First Naukratis Project Workshop held at The British Museum 16th –17th December 2011.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OD.098) (phase 3)
